page.title: 10FARMING IN THEDDINGWORTH
page.content: Main crops are wheat, barley, & oilseed rape; 3 farms have dairy herds & 8 have flocks of sheep, fattening cattle is the other main feature. The majority of farmers own extensive machinery primarily for their own use, these include tractors, combine harvesters, corn driers & milking machines. 6 substantial areas of land are operated by farmers living & farming more than 2 miles outside the block, 2 of these are entirely grass & 4 entirely arable. 3 smallholding units consist of 1 breeding rare Soay sheep, 1 breeding horses & 1 horticultural unit growing asparagus & Christmas trees. The owners of these enterprises also have other employment. The block is mainly watered by a natural water supply, this includes springs, the river Welland & tributary, also mains water.
